main.educationTitle: ONLINE COURSE ON MODELING CHEMICAL REACTIONS.
main.educationDescr1: As part of this 10-week course, students will learn to use quantum chemistry methods and calculate the properties of chemical substances and simulate chemical reactions, including using supercomputers.
main.educationDescr2: The course has a strong practical focus and is based on calculations using widely used quantum chemical software packages ORCA and Molcas.

research1.mainTitle1: Development of new genetically encoded tools
research1.mainDescr: Proteins from the rhodopsin family, the fluorescence intensity of which depends on the electrical potential of the cell, are a promising tool for biomedical research.
research1.advLeftTitle: Rhodopsins have already found use in studying the functioning of the brain, allowing real-time monitoring of neuronal activity using optical methods. The advantages of these molecular tools:
research1.advDescr1: Fast response time, allowing you to record even the fastest processes in neurons;
research1.advDescr2: Long-term photobleaching, which allows the use of rhodopsins in experiments that last for several hours;
research1.advDescr3: High sensitivity of fluorescence intensity to changes in electrical potential.
research1.disAdvLeftTitle: The main disadvantages of rhodopsin-based sensors developed to date:
research1.disAdvDescr1: Low fluorescent signal intensity (signal needs to be increased)
research1.disAdvDescr2: The absorption band is in a non-optimal range for biomedical research (it is necessary to shift the band to the region of the window of optical transparency of biological tissues, 650-900 nm)
research1.ourGoalTitle: Our task is to develop improved versions of rhodopsins, devoid of these disadvantages, but retaining all the advantages already achieved.
research1.combineTitle: TO SOLVE THE PROBLEM, WE USE A COMBINED APPROACH:
research1.combine1: Directed evolution to generate large numbers of "good" and "bad" mutant forms
research1.combine2: Comparative analysis of "bad" and "good" proteins to determine the factors that separate the two classes
research1.combine3: Rational design - based on the identified factors, propose new amino acid substitutions that will lead to additional optimization of properties
research1.experMethodsTitle: WE USE BOTH EXPERIMENTAL METHODS AND COMPUTER MODELING METHODS, NAMELY:
research1.experMethods1: Genetic engineering methods for obtaining mutant forms of proteins
research1.experMethods2: Spectroscopy methods for studying the spectral and photophysical properties of proteins
research1.experMethods3: Computer modeling methods for studying the factors that determine the fluorescence intensity of proteins at the molecular level, including homology modeling methods, molecular dynamics, QM/MM
research1.experMethods4: Genetic algorithms for automatic search for proteins with increased fluorescence intensity in silico
research1.resultsDescr: TO DATE, WE HAVE ALREADY OBTAINED PROTEINS WITH AN ABSORPTION BAND MAXIMUM AT 640 NM - THE LONGEST WAVELENGTH OF THE ABSORPTION BAND MAXIMUM AMONG KNOWN RHODOPSIN-BASED SENSORS.
